metadata.title: CVE-2024-10979 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect control of environment variables in PostgreSQL PL/Perl allows anunprivileged database user to change sensitive process environmentvariables (e.g. PATH).  That often suffices to enable arbitrary codeexecution, even if the attacker lacks a database server operating systemuser.  Versions before PostgreSQL 17.1, 16.5, 15.9, 14.14, 13.17, and 12.21are affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-10979` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 12.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libecpg6 - 12.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 12.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpq5 - 12.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-12 - 12.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-client-12 - 12.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plperl-12 - 12.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-12 - 12.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-12 - 12.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-12 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
